NameStyle.Name: Altmer
NameStyle.Description: The Altmer, or High Elves, are a tall, golden-skinned race, hailing from Summerset Isle.

NameStyle.Name: Argonian
NameStyle.Description: Argonians are the reptilian natives of Black Marsh, a vast swampland province in southeastern Tamriel.

NameStyle.Name: Ashlander
NameStyle.Description: The Ashlanders, also called the Velothi after the prophet Veloth, are Dunmeri nomads that traditionally hail from Morrowind's wilderness.

NameStyle.Name: Bosmer
NameStyle.Description: The Bosmer are the Elven clan-folk of Valenwood, a forested province in southwestern Tamriel.

NameStyle.Name: Breton
NameStyle.Description: Bretons are the human descendants of the Aldmeri-Nedic Manmer of the Merethic Era and are now the inhabitants of the province of High Rock.

NameStyle.Name: Dunmer
NameStyle.Description: The Dunmer, also known as Dark Elves, are the ash-skinned, typically red-eyed elven peoples of Morrowind.

NameStyle.Name: Imperial
NameStyle.Description: Also known as Cyrodiils, the well-educated and well-spoken Imperials are the natives of the civilized, cosmopolitan province of Cyrodiil.

NameStyle.Name: Khajiit
NameStyle.Description: Khajiit are cat-like people who come from Elsweyr, known for high intelligence and agility.

NameStyle.Name: Nord
NameStyle.Description: The Nords are the children of the sky, a race of tall and fair-haired humans from Skyrim who are known for their incredible resistance to cold and magical frost.

NameStyle.Name: Reachman
NameStyle.Description: The Reachmen are a tribal group of primarily Breton descent who inhabit the Reach in southwestern Skyrim and the neighboring Western Reach in the east of High Rock.

NameStyle.Name: Redguard
NameStyle.Description: Redguards are the dark-skinned, wiry-haired people of Hammerfell.

NameStyle.Name: Polish
NameStyle.Description: The Poles are a nation and West Slavic ethnic group native to Poland.

NameStyle.Name: Anglo-Saxon
NameStyle.Description: The Anglo-Saxons were the dominant people living in England from the mid-5th century AD until the Norman conquest in 1066.

NameStyle.Name: Briton
NameStyle.Description: The Britons were Celtic people who inhabited Great Britain from the British Iron Age into the Middle Ages, at which point their culture and language diverged.

NameStyle.Name: Gaelic
NameStyle.Description: The Gaels are an ethnolinguistic group native to northwestern Europe. They are associated with a branch of the Celtic languages comprising Irish, Manx and Scottish Gaelic.

NameStyle.Name: Norse
NameStyle.Description: Norsemen are the group of people who spoke what is now called the Old Norse language between the 8th and 11th centuries.
